hypertension.definition: A condition where the force of blood against artery walls is too high.

diabetes mellitus.definition: A metabolic disease characterized by high blood sugar levels.

type 1 diabetes mellitus.definition: An autoimmune condition where the pancreas produces little or no insulin.

type 2 diabetes mellitus.definition: A condition where the body becomes resistant to insulin or doesn't produce enough insulin.

prediabetes.definition: A condition where blood sugar levels are higher than normal but not high enough to be classified as diabetes.

myocardial infarction.definition: A condition where blood flow to a part of the heart is blocked, causing damage to the heart muscle.

unstable angina.definition: A condition characterized by chest pain that occurs even at rest or with minimal exertion.

stable angina.definition: A condition characterized by chest pain that occurs with physical exertion or stress.

acute coronary syndrome.definition: A term used to describe a range of conditions associated with sudden, reduced blood flow to the heart.

cerebrovascular accident.definition: A condition where blood flow to a part of the brain is interrupted, leading to brain damage.

transient ischemic attack.definition: A temporary period of symptoms similar to those of a stroke, usually lasting a few minutes.

intracerebral hemorrhage.definition: A type of stroke caused by bleeding within the brain tissue.

subarachnoid hemorrhage.definition: A type of stroke caused by bleeding into the space surrounding the brain.

ischemic stroke.definition: A type of stroke caused by a blockage in a blood vessel supplying the brain.

hemorrhagic stroke.definition: A type of stroke caused by bleeding into the brain.

asthma.definition: A condition characterized by inflammation and narrowing of the airways, leading to difficulty breathing.

exercise-induced asthma.definition: A type of asthma triggered by physical activity.

allergic asthma.definition: A type of asthma triggered by allergens.

chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.definition: A group of lung conditions that cause breathing difficulties.

chronic bronchitis.definition: A condition characterized by inflammation of the bronchial tubes, leading to coughing and mucus production.

emphysema.definition: A condition characterized by damage to the air sacs in the lungs, leading to shortness of breath.

bronchiectasis.definition: A condition characterized by abnormal widening of the bronchi, leading to mucus buildup and infection.

pulmonary fibrosis.definition: A condition characterized by scarring of the lung tissue, leading to difficulty breathing.

idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.definition: A type of pulmonary fibrosis with no known cause.

bronchiolitis obliterans.definition: A condition characterized by inflammation and scarring of the small airways in the lungs.

pneumonia.definition: An infection that inflames the air sacs in the lungs, which may fill with fluid or pus.

community-acquired pneumonia.definition: Pneumonia acquired outside of a hospital or healthcare setting.

hospital-acquired pneumonia.definition: Pneumonia acquired during a hospital stay.

ventilator-associated pneumonia.definition: Pneumonia acquired while on a ventilator.

aspiration pneumonia.definition: Pneumonia caused by inhaling foreign material into the lungs.

tuberculosis.definition: An infectious disease caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis, primarily affecting the lungs.

multidrug-resistant tuberculosis.definition: A form of tuberculosis resistant to multiple antibiotics.

fever.definition: An increase in body temperature above the normal range, often due to an infection.

hyperthermia.definition: A condition characterized by an abnormally high body temperature, often due to exposure to high temperatures.

hypothermia.definition: A condition characterized by an abnormally low body temperature, often due to exposure to cold temperatures.

sepsis.definition: A life-threatening condition caused by the body's response to an infection.

septic shock.definition: A severe form of sepsis characterized by a significant drop in blood pressure.

urosepsis.definition: Sepsis originating from a urinary tract infection.

hyperlipidemia.definition: A condition characterized by elevated levels of lipids in the blood.

familial hypercholesterolemia.definition: A genetic condition characterized by high cholesterol levels from birth.

hypolipidemia.definition: A condition characterized by abnormally low levels of lipids in the blood.

hypertriglyceridemia.definition: A condition characterized by elevated levels of triglycerides in the blood.

hypothyroidism.definition: A condition characterized by an underactive thyroid gland, leading to a decrease in hormone production.

congenital hypothyroidism.definition: Hypothyroidism present at birth, often due to a developmental problem with the thyroid gland.

subclinical hypothyroidism.definition: A mild form of hypothyroidism where thyroid hormone levels are slightly below normal but symptoms are minimal.

hyperthyroidism.definition: A condition characterized by an overactive thyroid gland, leading to an increase in hormone production.

graves disease.definition: An autoimmune disorder that leads to overactivity of the thyroid gland.

toxic nodular goiter.definition: A condition characterized by the presence of one or more nodules in the thyroid gland that produce excess thyroid hormones.

coronary artery disease.definition: A condition characterized by the narrowing or blockage of the coronary arteries, leading to reduced blood flow to the heart.

peripheral artery disease.definition: A condition characterized by the narrowing or blockage of the arteries outside the heart, often affecting the legs.

congestive heart failure.definition: A condition characterized by the heart's inability to pump blood effectively, leading to fluid buildup in the body.

heart failure with reduced ejection frac.definition: A type of heart failure where the heart muscle is weakened and cannot pump blood effectively.

heart failure with preserved ejection fr.definition: A type of heart failure where the heart muscle is stiff and cannot fill with blood effectively.

cardiomyopathy.definition: A disease of the heart muscle that affects its ability to pump blood.

hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.definition: A condition characterized by the thickening of the heart muscle, leading to reduced blood flow.

dilated cardiomyopathy.definition: A condition characterized by the enlargement of the heart chambers, leading to reduced pumping ability.

renal failure.definition: A condition characterized by the loss of kidney function, leading to the accumulation of waste products in the body.

acute renal failure.definition: A sudden loss of kidney function, often due to injury or illness.

chronic kidney disease.definition: A long-term condition characterized by the gradual loss of kidney function over time.

nephrotic syndrome.definition: A condition characterized by the presence of protein in the urine, leading to swelling and other symptoms.

nephritic syndrome.definition: A condition characterized by the presence of blood in the urine, leading to inflammation of the kidneys.

hepatitis.definition: Inflammation of the liver, often caused by viral infection or alcohol abuse.

viral hepatitis.definition: Hepatitis caused by a viral infection, such as hepatitis A, B, or C.

alcoholic hepatitis.definition: Hepatitis caused by excessive alcohol consumption.

autoimmune hepatitis.definition: Hepatitis caused by the body's immune system attacking the liver.

cirrhosis.definition: A condition characterized by the scarring of the liver tissue, leading to loss of function.

non-alcoholic fatty liver disease.definition: A condition characterized by the accumulation of fat in the liver, not caused by alcohol consumption.

non-alcoholic steatohepatitis.definition: A more severe form of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, characterized by inflammation and liver damage.

hepatocellular carcinoma.definition: A type of cancer that originates in the liver.

pancreatitis.definition: Inflammation of the pancreas, often caused by gallstones or alcohol abuse.

acute pancreatitis.definition: A sudden inflammation of the pancreas, often causing severe abdominal pain.

chronic pancreatitis.definition: A long-term inflammation of the pancreas, leading to permanent damage.

gastroesophageal reflux disease.definition: A condition characterized by the backward flow of stomach acid into the esophagus, causing heartburn and other symptoms.

peptic ulcer disease.definition: A condition characterized by the presence of ulcers in the stomach or duodenum.

gastric ulcer.definition: An ulcer that forms in the lining of the stomach.

duodenal ulcer.definition: An ulcer that forms in the lining of the duodenum.

hiatal hernia.definition: A condition where a portion of the stomach protrudes through the diaphragm into the chest cavity.

irritable bowel syndrome.definition: A condition characterized by abdominal pain, bloating, and changes in bowel habits.

inflammatory bowel disease.definition: A group of conditions characterized by chronic inflammation of the digestive tract.

ulcerative colitis.definition: A type of inflammatory bowel disease characterized by inflammation and ulcers in the colon and rectum.

crohn disease.definition: A type of inflammatory bowel disease characterized by inflammation of the digestive tract, often affecting the small intestine.

celiac disease.definition: An autoimmune disorder where the ingestion of gluten leads to damage in the small intestine.

diverticulosis.definition: A condition characterized by the presence of small pouches in the colon.

diverticulitis.definition: Inflammation of the diverticula in the colon, often causing abdominal pain and fever.

helicobacter pylori infection.definition: An infection caused by the bacterium Helicobacter pylori, often leading to stomach ulcers.

urinary tract infection.definition: An infection in any part of the urinary system, including the kidneys, bladder, and urethra.

pyelonephritis.definition: An infection of the kidneys, often caused by bacteria.

interstitial cystitis.definition: A condition characterized by chronic pain and pressure in the bladder.

urethritis.definition: Inflammation of the urethra, often caused by infection.

nephrolithiasis.definition: A condition characterized by the presence of stones in the kidneys.

meningitis.definition: Inflammation of the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord, often caused by infection.

viral meningitis.definition: Meningitis caused by a viral infection.

bacterial meningitis.definition: Meningitis caused by a bacterial infection.

encephalitis.definition: Inflammation of the brain, often caused by infection.

dermatitis.definition: Inflammation of the skin, often causing itching and redness.

atopic dermatitis.definition: A chronic skin condition characterized by itchy, inflamed skin.

contact dermatitis.definition: A skin condition caused by contact with an irritant or allergen.

psoriasis.definition: A chronic skin condition characterized by red, scaly patches.

seborrheic dermatitis.definition: A skin condition characterized by red, scaly patches, often on the scalp.

acne vulgaris.definition: A skin condition characterized by pimples, blackheads, and whiteheads.

rosacea.definition: A skin condition characterized by redness and visible blood vessels on the face.

urticaria.definition: A skin condition characterized by red, itchy welts.

cellulitis.definition: A bacterial skin infection characterized by redness, swelling, and pain.

fungal skin infection.definition: A skin infection caused by fungi.

onychomycosis.definition: A fungal infection of the nails.

impetigo.definition: A bacterial skin infection characterized by red sores and blisters.

scabies.definition: A skin condition caused by the infestation of the skin by the Sarcoptes scabiei mite.

pediculosis.definition: A condition caused by the infestation of the skin by lice.

allergic rhinitis.definition: An allergic reaction to airborne allergens, causing sneezing, runny nose, and congestion.

sinusitis.definition: Inflammation of the sinuses, often caused by infection.

otitis media.definition: An infection of the middle ear, often causing ear pain and fever.

otitis externa.definition: An infection of the outer ear canal, often caused by water exposure.

tonsillitis.definition: Inflammation of the tonsils, often caused by infection.

laryngitis.definition: Inflammation of the larynx, often causing hoarseness or loss of voice.

pharyngitis.definition: Inflammation of the pharynx, often causing a sore throat.

bronchitis.definition: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes, often causing coughing and mucus production.

laryngotracheobronchitis.definition: Inflammation of the larynx, trachea, and bronchi, often causing a barking cough.

epiglottitis.definition: Inflammation of the epiglottis, often causing difficulty breathing and swallowing.

influenza.definition: A viral infection affecting the respiratory system, often causing fever, cough, and body aches.

common cold.definition: A viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, often causing a runny nose, sore throat, and cough.

respiratory syncytial virus infection.definition: A viral infection affecting the respiratory system, often causing cold-like symptoms.

measles.definition: A highly contagious viral infection characterized by a red rash and fever.

mumps.definition: A viral infection characterized by swelling of the parotid glands.

rubella.definition: A viral infection characterized by a red rash and fever, often mild in children but dangerous in pregnant women.

varicella.definition: A highly contagious viral infection characterized by an itchy rash and blisters.

herpes zoster.definition: A viral infection characterized by a painful rash, often occurring in older adults who have had chickenpox.

obesity.definition: A condition characterized by excessive body fat, often leading to health problems.

morbid obesity.definition: A severe form of obesity, often associated with serious health risks.

anorexia nervosa.definition: An eating disorder characterized by an intense fear of gaining weight and a distorted body image.

bulimia nervosa.definition: An eating disorder characterized by episodes of binge eating followed by purging.

binge eating disorder.definition: An eating disorder characterized by episodes of binge eating without purging.

osteoporosis.definition: A condition characterized by weak and brittle bones, often leading to fractures.

osteopenia.definition: A condition characterized by lower than normal bone density, but not as severe as osteoporosis.

gout.definition: A form of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe attacks of pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.

pseudogout.definition: A form of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe attacks of pain, redness, and tenderness in joints, caused by calcium pyrophosphate crystals.

vitamin d deficiency.definition: A condition characterized by low levels of vitamin D, often leading to bone problems.

iron deficiency anemia.definition: A condition characterized by a lack of iron, leading to a decrease in the number of red blood cells.

anemia.definition: A condition characterized by a decrease in the number of red blood cells or hemoglobin in the blood.

aplastic anemia.definition: A condition characterized by the failure of the bone marrow to produce enough blood cells.

hemolytic anemia.definition: A condition characterized by the destruction of red blood cells faster than they can be produced.

sickle cell anemia.definition: A genetic condition characterized by abnormal hemoglobin, leading to misshapen red blood cells.

thalassemia.definition: A genetic condition characterized by abnormal hemoglobin production, leading to anemia.

leukemia.definition: A cancer of the blood-forming tissues, leading to an increase in abnormal white blood cells.

acute lymphoblastic leukemia.definition: A type of leukemia characterized by the rapid growth of immature lymphocytes.

acute myeloid leukemia.definition: A type of leukemia characterized by the rapid growth of immature myeloid cells.

chronic lymphocytic leukemia.definition: A type of leukemia characterized by the slow growth of mature lymphocytes.

chronic myeloid leukemia.definition: A type of leukemia characterized by the slow growth of mature myeloid cells.

lymphoma.definition: A cancer of the lymphatic system, often affecting the lymph nodes.

Hodgkin lymphoma.definition: A type of lymphoma characterized by the presence of Reed-Sternberg cells.

non-Hodgkin lymphoma.definition: A type of lymphoma not characterized by the presence of Reed-Sternberg cells.

multiple myeloma.definition: A cancer of the plasma cells, often affecting the bone marrow.

monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined si.definition: A condition characterized by the presence of abnormal proteins in the blood, often a precursor to multiple myeloma.

melanoma.definition: A type of skin cancer that originates in the melanocytes.

basal cell carcinoma.definition: A type of skin cancer that originates in the basal cells.

squamous cell carcinoma.definition: A type of skin cancer that originates in the squamous cells.

prostate cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the prostate gland.

breast cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the breast tissue.

lung cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the lungs.

small cell lung cancer.definition: A type of lung cancer characterized by small cells, often aggressive.

non-small cell lung cancer.definition: A type of lung cancer characterized by larger cells, often less aggressive than small cell lung cancer.

colon cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the colon.

rectal cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the rectum.

pancreatic cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the pancreas.

renal cell carcinoma.definition: A cancer that originates in the kidneys.

bladder cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the bladder.

ovarian cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the ovaries.

endometrial cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the lining of the uterus.

cervical cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the cervix.

testicular cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the testicles.

brain tumor.definition: A mass of abnormal cells in the brain.

glioblastoma.definition: A highly aggressive type of brain tumor.

meningioma.definition: A tumor that originates in the meninges, the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord.

eye cancer.definition: A cancer that originates in the eye.

retinoblastoma.definition: A cancer that originates in the retina, often affecting children.

leukoplakia.definition: A condition characterized by white patches on the mucous membranes, often in the mouth.

erythroplakia.definition: A condition characterized by red patches on the mucous membranes, often in the mouth.

glaucoma.definition: A condition characterized by damage to the optic nerve, often leading to vision loss.

open-angle glaucoma.definition: A type of glaucoma characterized by a gradual increase in eye pressure.

angle-closure glaucoma.definition: A type of glaucoma characterized by a sudden increase in eye pressure.

cataract.definition: A condition characterized by clouding of the lens of the eye, leading to vision loss.

age-related macular degeneration.definition: A condition characterized by damage to the macula, leading to vision loss.

retinal detachment.definition: A condition characterized by the separation of the retina from the underlying tissue.

diabetic retinopathy.definition: A condition characterized by damage to the blood vessels in the retina, often caused by diabetes.

macular edema.definition: A condition characterized by swelling of the macula, often caused by diabetes.

conjunctivitis.definition: Inflammation of the conjunctiva, often causing redness and itching.

uveitis.definition: Inflammation of the uvea, the middle layer of the eye.

blepharitis.definition: Inflammation of the eyelids, often causing redness and itching.

otosclerosis.definition: A condition characterized by abnormal growth of the bones in the middle ear, leading to hearing loss.

Meniere disease.definition: A condition characterized by episodes of vertigo, hearing loss, and tinnitus.

vertigo.definition: A sensation of spinning or dizziness, often caused by inner ear problems.

tinnitus.definition: A condition characterized by ringing or buzzing in the ears.

hearing loss.definition: A condition characterized by a decrease in the ability to hear.

otitis media with effusion.definition: A condition characterized by fluid buildup in the middle ear, often causing hearing loss.

sensorineural hearing loss.definition: A type of hearing loss caused by damage to the inner ear or auditory nerve.

conductive hearing loss.definition: A type of hearing loss caused by problems in the outer or middle ear.

aphasia.definition: A condition characterized by the loss of the ability to understand or express speech.

dementia.definition: A condition characterized by a decline in cognitive function, often affecting memory and thinking.

Alzheimer disease.definition: A progressive neurodegenerative disease characterized by memory loss and cognitive decline.
